newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Techcomm warns of lower full year profit.
newsitem.headline: Techcomm warns of lower full year profit.

text.p: Information technology group Techcomm Group said on Thursday it had lowered its profit expectation for the year to June 30, 1997 and expected operating profits after tax would be less than the A$1.1 million achieved in 1995/96.

Foreign exchange movements, the late completion of several projects and higher maintainance costs had forced the profit downgrade, the company said, after reviewing results from the first 11 months of the year.
Company directors were working with management to refocus the company's businesses and the company still had healthy cash flows, it said.
"With significant cash reserves and A$9 million of undrawn bank facilities the company is well positioned to exploit current and future opportunities in 1997/98 and beyond," it said.
Techcomm's shares were unchanged at 37 cents at 1.10 p.m. (0310 GMT).
